sub_title: Managing Director at the Netherlands-African Business Council
summary:
I am a multitalented international professional with 20 years experience in the private, public and non-profit sector. I have worked in 3 different continents and 5 different countries and I can truly say I have experience in working in multicultural and cross-functional teams. 

I’ve built my career in a variety of roles and industries, this made me the person I am today; flexible, a hands-on attitude and a great team player who is not afraid to take on a variety of projects. I’m not only used to wearing many hats, I sincerely enjoy it; I thrive in an environment where no two working days are exactly the same. I am an expert in management consultancy, project management, technology matchmaking, international market research and business development. I totally enjoy networking and organizing (networking) events and I have a talent for teambuilding & management training.

I have worn many hats in my career, as a result I have a unique ability to work in multi-disciplinary projects, but I believe that my professional value boils down to my work experience in all three sectors (public, private & non-profit) and my ability to adapt to new situations/projects.

I am passionate about working in the NGO/non-profit sector because it engages both my heart and head and allows me to use my skills and knowledge to contribute to a positive impact in people’s lives, the wellbeing of animals and the environment. 

Multilingual: Dutch, English, Spanish and some French

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

profile_positions.description:
The Netherlands-African Business Council (NABC) is the leading organisation for trade and investment facilitation for Africa in the Netherlands. 

At NABC we believe that the Dutch private sector has a prominent role to play in the sustainable development of the African continent. Therefore, NABC’s purpose is to inform, inspire, catalyse and connect businesses with Africa’s opportunities and to assist businesses in making confident decisions about when, where and how to do business in Africa. 

The NABC today leads a network of nearly 250 engaged and diverse members and has access to a community of over 10,000 African and European businesses, institutes, government entities and others interested in doing business in Africa.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
I am responsible for the overall coordination of Africa Works!, NABC’s flagship event. Africa Works! is a thematic biennial conference organized to position, promote and market the African continent as a valuable trade and investment destination. 

Africa Works! 2019, the fourth edition of this powerful conference, took place in April and presented the theme of Future African Cities. Africa Works! 2019 welcomed over 600 participants and 12 African delegations. The conference featured 13 keynote speakers, 2 high-level Round Tables and 25 inspiring workshops about themes related to urbanization challenges African growing cities are facing. www.africaworks.nl

I am responsible for the business development of the blue-green (irrigation) sector within NABC: agriculture production is highly dependent on water and is increasingly subject to water risks. It is also the largest water using sector and a major polluter of water. Improving agriculture's water management and irrigation technology is therefore essential to a sustainable and productive agro-food sector in Africa.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Africa Works! Conference & blue-green (irrigation) sector business development

profile_positions.description:
I was hired by Aqua for All as external consultant for phase 1 of the Safe Water for All Malawi Program. This ambitious Household Water Treatment and Safe Storage (HWTS) program aims to provide safe water at point of use for the entire population of Malawi by using a household water filter. During Phase 1 I have visited Malawi on a "scoping mission". The aim of this visit was to get a better understanding of the current drinking water situation in Malawi including the current water quality and the stakeholders involved in drinking water supply & quality like government and NGO’s. Additionally, I researched  the role of the private sector in HWTS products, as well as the current supply chain and finance systems for HWTS products in Malawi. The results and recommendations were presented in a report and presentation. 

Aqua for All is a non-profit organization that brings parties together to increase the access to safe water and sanitation services. With roots  from both the public and the private sector, Aqua for All plays a role as advisor for the creation of Public Private Partnerships and focuses on the upscaling of proven innovative approaches and financial sustainability of services. Aqua for All believes that programs succeed in the long term when they stimulate local markets and provide jobs. Aqua for All always works in partnerships, mainly in Africa and Asia.
profile_positions.title: Consultant at Aqua for All

profile_positions.description:
As team member of Water Innovators 2017 I have been instrumental in the  initial stage of WaterAid's employee development programme aimed at WaterAid's water industry partners and corporate partners. This year's water challenge involved 40 teams from 5 different countries  competing to solve a real water/sanitation problem in Nicaragua. 

As member of the Corporate Partnerships Team I researched how to further expand WaterAid's Corporate Partnerships by analysing industries, CSR trends, corporate partnerships at other NGO's/charities and identifying potential corporate partners. Furthermore, I  dealt with the smaller partnership/sponsor requests received by WaterAid in the corporate inbox.

As a WaterAid speaker I delivered talks to a variety of community groups to educate people about the lack of clean water and sanitation in the poorest parts of the world with the aim to inspire people to support the vital work of WaterAid and transform the lives of the most marginalised people on this planet.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Partnerships, Water Innovators 2017 and part of WaterAid's Speaker Network

profile_positions.description:
TABLEsenses is a new, "never-done-before" creative entertainment concept introduced in Singapore in spring 2015. 

The main element of TABLEsenses is our centrepiece:  a long (and we mean long!) table for about 100 people. This great table will double as stage. TABLEsenses will trigger, shuffle, deceive, maximise and minimise the senses through an unforgettable experience with performing arts and food.

As business director at TABLEsenses I had the challenging job to launch this amazing food & performing arts concept in the Singapore market by identifying business opportunities and managing relationships with our partners and key clients. I co-created the business plan and marketing strategy for TABLEsenses and I was responsible for the social media strategy.
profile_positions.title: Business Director

profile_positions.description: Developed an innovation training aimed at SME’s in Singapore.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Consultant

company.name: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Singapore

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Singapore
profile_positions.description:
Strengthened the competitiveness of Dutch knowledge & expertise in the field of water technology, delta technology and the maritime sector.

Key accomplishments:
Organized a successful study trip for the Singaporean Minister of the Environment and Water Resources, Dr. Vivian Balakrishnan, and his delegation to the Netherlands to showcase the Dutch expertise in the field of water technology and delta technology.

Overall coordination of a productive Dutch participation at the Singapore International water Week 2012 (trade show, Dutch speakers at conferences, VIP dinner event).

Technology matchmaking between Dutch and Singaporean parties (B2B, K2K, K2B and G2G).

Publication of articles on water topics and an analysis of the water sector in Singapore.
profile_positions.title: Science & Technology Advisor - Environment & Water

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Singapore
profile_positions.description:
Promoted Dutch knowledge and expertise in the field of water & delta technology, energy, creative industry, food & nutrition and life sciences.

Main tasks:
Identifying opportunities for science and technology collaboration between Singapore and the Netherlands.

Technology matchmaking between Dutch and Singaporean parties (B2B, K2K, K2B and G2G).

Information transfer about science & technology between the Netherlands and Singapore.
profile_positions.title: Interim Science & Technology Advisor

profile_positions.company: NBTC Netherlands Board of Tourism & Conventions
profile_positions.description:
In charge of the promotion of the Netherlands as a congress destination for the non- corporate convention market in Switzerland.

Responsibilities:
Performing research of the association market in Switzerland.

Actively approaching the international association market in Switzerland by establishing a local and international network.

Acting as the intermediary between the international association market in Switzerland and their counterparts and partners in the Netherlands.

Organizing networking events for Swiss-based associations and representatives of the Dutch congress sector.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer non-corporate convention market

profile_positions.description: Performed market research for the Dutch market (the 2nd largest market for IMD Business School). Analyzed the Dutch customers of IMD over a period of 17 years and identified trends in their behaviour.

company.name: Consulate General of the Netherlands in Miami, USA

profile_positions.company: Consulate General of the Netherlands in Miami, USA
profile_positions.description:
Successfully established the economic department of the Consulate General of the Netherlands in Miami. Initiated the first “Nano4food” conference to be held in the United States, which was intended to promote Dutch expertise in the application of nanotechnology in the food industry and knowledge sharing between the Dutch and American nanotechnology industry.

Responsibilities:
Promoting and facilitating Dutch export and Dutch direct investment in the South-Eastern USA.
Organizing networking events, Dutch participation at trade shows, and matchmaking activities for Dutch companies with their American counterparts.

Informing Dutch public and private sector about opportunities in the South-Eastern USA by writing articles, giving presentations, conducting market research and writing sector reports.

Establishing an international and national network in the South-Eastern USA and the Netherlands.

Budget control and coordinating website of the economic department economic department.
profile_positions.title: Senior Commercial Officer
